qas.question: Who set up an astronomical observatory on Saint Helena?
What university did Edmond Halley attend?
How many feet was the telescope that was set up in the observatory?
What district is the telescope set up in?
What hemisphere of stars did Edmond Halley want to study with the telescope?

context: On leaving the <a1_0>University of Oxford<a1_0/>, in 1676, <a0_0>Edmond Halley<a0_0/> visited Saint Helena and set up an astronomical observatory with a 7.3-metre-long (<a2_0>24<a2_0/> ft) aerial telescope with the intention of studying stars from the <a4_0>Southern<a4_0/> Hemisphere. The site of this telescope is near Saint Mathew's Church in Hutt's Gate, in the <a3_0>Longwood district<a3_0/>. The 680-metre (2,230 ft) high hill there is named for him and is called Halley's Mount.
